Package agile.planner.schedule

Interface Scheduler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CompactScheduler, DynamicScheduler
    public interface Scheduler
    The interface Scheduler is for all scheduling implementations to sort out tasks via the ScheduleManager
    Since:
    0.3.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int assignDay​(Day day, int errorCount, java.util.PriorityQueue<Task> complete, java.util.PriorityQueue<Task> taskManager)
      Assigns current Day a set of Task.SubTask via one of the specified scheduling algorithms
      boolean correctSchedule​(java.util.List<Day> schedule, int errorCount)
      Corrects schedule by eliminating all overflows via adjusting number of hours per day

    • Method Detail

      • assignDay

        int assignDay​(Day day,
              int errorCount,
              java.util.PriorityQueue<Task> complete,
              java.util.PriorityQueue<Task> taskManager)
        Assigns current Day a set of Task.SubTask via one of the specified scheduling algorithms
        Parameters:
        day - Day being processed
        errorCount - number of errors in current schedule
        complete - Tasks that are "finished scheduling" are added here
        taskManager - PriorityQueue of all Tasks in sorted order
        Returns:
        number of errors in scheduling Day

      • correctSchedule

        boolean correctSchedule​(java.util.List<Day> schedule,
                        int errorCount)
        Corrects schedule by eliminating all overflows via adjusting number of hours per day

        NOTE: This assumes that past days are stored in an archived list (thus, the first index of schedule is for today)

        Parameters:
        schedule - list of days scheduled
        errorCount - number of errors currently in schedule
        Returns:
        boolean value if successful (e.g. would be false if there are more than 24 hours assigned for a task due today)
